summary: An email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York to an unidentified recipient, sent on January 30, 2021, requesting to schedule an initial call. The email attaches notes from a February 2016 meeting and provides a link to a news article about the Jeffrey Epstein and Maxwell case.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the email, working for the United States Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, is reaching out to schedule a call regarding the Epstein/Maxwell case.

events.title: February 2016 Meeting
events.description: A meeting for which notes and business cards were attached to the email. The specific content or attendees are not detailed in the provided text.

events.title: Prosecutor's Outreach Email
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney emails an unidentified recipient to schedule an initial call, providing case-related materials.

locations: United States Attorney's Office Southern District of New York
keyFacts: Prosecutors from the SDNY were actively working on the Epstein/Maxwell case as of January 2021.
The communication references a specific meeting from February 2016, suggesting investigators were reviewing historical events.
The email included an attachment titled '2016.2.29_Meeting_Notes_and_Business_Cards.pdf', indicating the preservation of potential evidence.
The prosecutor provided a link to a New York Daily News article about the case, dated October 13, 2020.
